message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses the science of systematically observing how different machine learning approaches perform on a wide range of learning tasks, and then learning from this experience to learn new tasks much faster than otherwise possible. This is a core topic in machine learning, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category, as it covers the general field of machine learning. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also likely, as meta-learning is a subfield of AI. cs.CV (Computer Vision) is another possible sub-category, as meta-learning has been applied to computer vision tasks. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also possible, as meta-learning has been applied to neural network architectures. Finally, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is a less likely sub-category, but still possible, as meta-learning has been applied to natural language processing tasks.
